result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J. Holston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J. Holston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy J. Holston in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend 940.19(1) misd. battery.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:
12 months Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling/evaluation per agent
AODA & treatment
$350.00 Restitution with 15% Surcharge To:  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
$443..00 Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 

Count 2:  Dismiss but read in
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea hearing on May 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy J. Holston in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests reset for DE to get some money together to accept offer.  State agrees.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Tsai acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continues.

Defendant Jeremy J. Holston in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Tsai states DE will waive his right to prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.

Defendant Jeremy J. Holston in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests prelim.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states progress being made w/restitution but needs about 3 more weeks.  State requests DE appear.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy J. Holston in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai request status conference in 3 weeks.  Restitution at issue.  Matter likely to resolve.  No objection from the State.  Bond continues.  Status hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
no contact w/N.K or M.J.; Absolute Sobriety

Pre-trial conference at 10-23-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 11-03-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jeremy J. Holston appeared by video means with Attorney Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Defendant does qualify.  Time limits waived.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with NK or his companion, MJ.  Absolute sobriety and may not be present in any taverns.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
